definition: (military) offensive
to attack/to accuse/to study
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals
marketing campaign

sentences.english: In the American Civil War the Confederate state took the offensive.
sentences.chinese: 美國南北戰爭中，南軍採取攻勢。

sentences.english: The costs and value drivers are identified for each value activity.
sentences.chinese: 攻勢要檢查每項價值創造活動的成本和價值驅動力。

sentences.english: But the North Koreans know how to deal with a frontal assault.
sentences.chinese: 但是朝鮮人懂得如何消解正面的攻勢。

sentences.english: A big advertising campaign to promote our new toothpaste.
sentences.chinese: 推銷我廠新牙膏的一場大的廣告宣傳攻勢。

sentences.english: The company will launch an advertising campaign to introduce its new product.
sentences.chinese: 那個公司要發起廣告攻勢推出自己的新產品。

sentences.english: Their long-prepared offensive was launched in the middle of March.
sentences.chinese: 他們在3月中旬發起了準備已久的攻勢。

sentences.english: Roberts had drawn Carvalho and Terry before teeing the shot up.
sentences.chinese: 這次攻勢由羅伯茨牽引住卡瓦略和特里而鋪排的。

sentences.english: State and local governments are readying their publicity machines.
sentences.chinese: 州政府和各地政府也都準備好了宣傳攻勢。

sentences.english: Shen Zong Emperor began to assume a strategic offensive to the West Xia after his enthronement.
sentences.chinese: 宋神宗即位後，開始在戰略上對西夏採取攻勢。

sentences.english: Intelligence has〔have〕 reported that enemy is planning a new attack.
sentences.chinese: 情報人員報告說，敵軍正在策劃發動新攻勢。

sentences.english: Thee company will launch an advertising compaign to introduce its new product.
sentences.chinese: 那個公司要發起廣告攻勢推出自己的新產品。

sentences.english: The North has also been angered by a renewed propaganda drive from the South.
sentences.chinese: 北方對來自南方的新一輪的宣傳攻勢，也感到惱怒。

sentences.english: Tom met her on her launched offensive.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆一見到她就對她展開了攻勢。

sentences.english: A week later, she started pursuing Guolanjun offensive.
sentences.chinese: 一星期後，郭蘭軍對她展開追求攻勢。

sentences.english: Once Cold is granted asylum, the propaganda is dialed up.
sentences.chinese: 科爾德被允許避難之後，宣傳攻勢立即升級。

sentences.english: It is below the offensive with my powerful army, xu water city is very fast by breach.
sentences.chinese: 在我軍強大的攻勢下，徐水城很快就被攻破。

definition: to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to turn back/to reverse
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to counterattack/to come back after a defeat/to retrieve lost ground
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
opponent/rival/competitor/(well-matched) adversary/match
inferior/disadvantaged
to beat back/to repel
tactics
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
to suppress/to inhibit/to stifle
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
to undulate/to fluctuate/wave motion/rise and fall
